thread.title: Carnival Corporation expands in China, as it grows to be world's largest cruise market
thread.title_full: Carnival Corporation expands in China, as it grows to be world's largest cruise market

title: Carnival Corporation expands in China, as it grows to be world's largest cruise market
text:
Carnival Corporation expands in China, as it grows to be world's largest cruise market Carnival Corporation expands in China, as it grows to be world's largest cruise market THE world's largest cruise company, Carnival Corporation, is to increase its presence in China by doubling the number of its cruise brands that have ships based there. PUBLISHED: 00:00, Tue, Oct 20, 2015 | UPDATED: 22:44, Tue, Oct 20, 2015 GETTY China is expected to become the world's largest cruise market 
Carnival Cruise Line and AIDA Cruises will join Princess Cruises and Costa Cruises with China-based ships in 2017. 
The new-build ships will be specifically designed for the Chinese market and will bring the number of Carnival Corporations ships up to six by 2017. Related articles The cost of foreign holidays has plummeted just in time for the... 
Even before that, the Costa and Princess brands will potentially offer a total of four million passenger cruise days in 2016, giving Chinese guests more choice and flexibility. 
China is expected to become the world's largest cruise market, with ever-increasing demand from China's growing middle class. GETTY The new-build ships will be specifically designed for the Chinese market 
Carnival CEO Arnold Donald announced the news in Shanghai, at the 10th Annual China Cruise Shipping and International Cruise Expo. 
"As we execute our multi-brand growth strategy in China, we are emphasizing choice and variety in our offerings to match the different tastes and preferences of Chinese travelers," he said. GETTY Carnival Corporation brands operate 100 cruise ships, with 17 new ships scheduled to be delivered 
Christine Duffy, president of Carnival Cruise Line, added: "We greatly look forward to introducing Chinese guests to the exceptional vacation experience that has made Carnival the world's most popular cruise line with more than 4.5 million guests a year. We greatly look forward to introducing Chinese guests to the exceptional vacation experience that has made Carnival the world's most popular cruise line with more than 4.5 million guests a year Christine Duffy, president of Carnival Cruise Line 
"With cruise demand rapidly increasing in China and our ability to work in partnership with other Carnival Corporation brands to leverage our collective experience and scale, it provides an outstanding opportunity for Carnival Cruise Line to enter the Chinese market." 
Carnival Corporation is also exploring potential joint ventures with China State Shipbuilding Corporation and China Merchants Group to accelerate the growth of the cruise industry in China, with the possibility of launching a world-class Chinese domestic cruise brand and supporting port and infrastructure development. GETTY Carnival Corporation is expanding in China 
Carnival Corporation owns 10 cruise brands, including Cunard, P&O Cruises (UK and Australia), Seabourn, Holland America Line and the new ecotourism brand Fathom. 
Carnival Corporation brands operate 100 cruise ships, with 17 new ships scheduled to be delivered between 2016 and 2022. Related articles
